memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1731

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the public authorities law, in relation to providing for the
financing and construction of capital facilities for a certain
not-for-profit corporation

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
This bill provides the authorization for the Dormitory Authority of
the State of New York for the purpose of financing the construction
of a cancer treatment facility within the City of New York.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
Section 1 amends paragraph (b) of subdivision 2 of section 1677 of the
Public Authorities law and to add Maskil El-Dal, Inc., to authorize
the Dormitory Authority to provide assistance to the organization.

Section 2 amends Subdivision 1 of section 1680 of to add Maskil
El-Dal, Inc., to the list or organizations the Dormitory Authority to
provide assistance to.

Section 3 provides for an immediate effective date.

JUSTIFICATION:
This legislation is necessary to authorize the Dormitory Authority to
provide financial assistance for the construction of the cancer
treatment facility. The assistance would be in the form of a bond
issuance.
The debt and expenses of the project would be private debt, with no
obligation or cost to the state. The project would be subject to the
Dormitory Authority board review and approval and the review and
approval by the New York State Department of Health through the
Certificate of Need process.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2010: S.6278-A Reported to Rules
      A.9254-A Referred to Ways and Means

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS FOR STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS:
None to state. It may be argued that the construction jobs and
additional health care jobs created by this facility would increase
the revenue to the State and the City of New York.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediate.
